paper_abstract: Processing and presentation of major histocompatibility complex class I antigens to cytotoxic T-lymphocytes is crucial for immune surveillance against intracellular bacteria, parasites, viruses and tumors. Identification of antigenic regions on pathogen proteins will play a pivotal role in designer vaccine immunotherapy. We have developed a novel method that identifies MHC class I binding peptides from peptides sequences. For the first time we present a method for MHC class I binding peptides prediction using Fourier analysis and support vector machines (SVM). Using cross-validation, we demonstrate that this novel prediction technique has a reasonable performance.
paper_title: Prediction of MHC class I binding peptides using Fourier analysis and support vector machine
